database

Class DatabaseInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.DatabaseInterface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLiteInterface

    public abstract class DatabaseInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper for the database to separate its implementation from other aspects of the program. The Abstract DatabaseInterface exists to allow easy change to different storage mediums in the future with little pain, even allowing the listing of what features a given implementation supports and what it doesn't.
    Author:
    Michael Williams

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DatabaseInterface.MapSpecs
      Structural Class used for returning map data from the data storage medium of the Implementations.

    • Field Detail

      • supportList

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> supportList
        The support List contains strings stating what features an Implementation supports. "User" is required at the bare minimum. Other possible entries are: "Stats" "Games" "Maps"

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public abstract User getUser(java.lang.String username)
        Must return the user with the given username. If the username is not valid null is returned.
        Parameters:
        username - unique username
        Returns:
        User Object for given username, or null if not available

      • confirmUser

        public abstract boolean confirmUser(int uid,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Confirms that a given password is correct for the user corresponding to the given id. If the password is correct, it returns true, otherwise it returns false.
        Parameters:
        uid - User ID
        password - User Password
        Returns:
        Validity of password for given user

      • updateUser

        public abstract void updateUser(int uid,
              UserStatistics stats)
                         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Updates a given User's Statistics, providing the uid is valid, and the feature is supported. If the uid is invalid, nothing happens. If the feature is not supported, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        uid - User ID
        stats - User's Statistics
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • createStats

        public abstract void createStats(int uid)
                          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Creates empty Statistics entry for a given user.
        Parameters:
        uid - User ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • addUser

        public abstract User addUser(java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new user in the Implementation's backend. Username must be unique, otherwise null is returned.
        Parameters:
        username - Unique Username
        password - Password
        Returns:
        Newly Created User, or null if username is not Unique

      • userExists

        public abstract boolean userExists(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if a user exists or not. That is, it checks if a username is not unique.
        Parameters:
        username - Username to check.
        Returns:
        False if username is unique, True if username is already in use.

      • addGame

        public abstract void addGame(GameInfo game)
                      throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds a record of a finished game to the Implementation's data storage medium. If Implementation does not support Game record saving this method throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        game - Finished game to save
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getUserStats

        public abstract UserStatistics getUserStats(int uid)
                                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieves Statistics for a given user. If ID is invalid, returns null. If Implementation doesn't support Statistics, throws UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        uid - User ID
        Returns:
        User's Statistics
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

        Set's User's password to a new value.
        Parameters:
        uid - User ID
        newPassword - User's New Password

      • supports

        public boolean supports(java.lang.String capability)
        Checks if the implementation supports a given feature.
        Parameters:
        capability - Feature to check support for.
        Returns:
        Whether feature is supported.

      • getSupportList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSupportList()
        Returns List of Strings containing supported features.
        Returns:
        Supported Features List.

      • addMap

        public abstract void addMap(java.lang.String name,
          byte[] mapData,
          int width,
          int height)
                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds new map to the database. Name must be unique, otherwise method silently fails. If Implementation does not support storing and loading of maps, throws UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new map.
        mapData - Raw binary data for the layout of the map.
        width - Width of the map. width >= 0
        height - height of the map. height >= 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getMap

        public abstract DatabaseInterface.MapSpecs getMap(java.lang.String name)
                                           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieves map of given name from storage. If map isn't found returns null. If Implementation does not support storing and loading of maps, throws UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of Map to Load
        Returns:
        Structure containing width, height and raw data..
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getTopTenPlayerStats

        public abstract java.lang.String[][] getTopTenPlayerStats()
                                                   throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieves the Top ten players by wins. Outputs as a 2d array of strings. Returned string must be 2*10. 1st column is the username, 2nd column is the number of wins. Each Row is a separate player.
        Returns:
        2*10 array of strings with Top Ten Stats.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getHead2Head

        public abstract int[] getHead2Head(User user1,
                 User user2)
                            throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieves comparative wins between two users. returned value will be an array of ints of length 2. val[0] = Player One's Win count against Player Two. val[1] = Player Two's Win count against Player One.
        Parameters:
        user1 - Player One
        user2 - Player Two
        Returns:
        Vs. Win Count
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
